lead_paragraph: Fisk University’s quiet sale of Florine Stettheimer’s “Asbury Park South” highlights the minefield institutions must navigate when they use proceeds from art.

headline.print_headline: A College That Paid Bills by Selling Its Art
headline.main: A Prized Stettheimer Painting, Sold Under the Radar by a University

snippet: Fisk University’s quiet sale of Florine Stettheimer’s “Asbury Park South” highlights the minefield institutions must navigate when they use proceeds from art....
abstract: Fisk University draws criticism for selling two paintings from its Alfred Stieglitz art collection to cover shortfall in operating expenses; move highlights growing issue of whether institutions in dire financial straits should be allowed to sell off collections.
